column4: Hi guys...I could do with some help...I've just rebooted my machine to discover that all my shared folders have disappeared....there is no indication of them in 'places' etc....but I dont know what caused this?

Hi guys...I could do with some help...I've just rebooted my machine to discover that all my shared folders have disappeared....there is no indication of them in 'places' etc....but I dont know what caused this?
can anyone help?
are the directories still there physically? just cus they are gone from places doesn't mean they are necassarily gone
all references to the shared folders are gone, with the exception of 'shared folders'.  The path is still there, but tells me it is inaccessible
try sudo mount -a
samba shared or nfs?
samba
you might want to check your samba config file and make sure it didn't somehow get erased...
neither of my mounted drives are visible..
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/46992/
is it at all possible that you had a second partition with ubuntu installed on it?
..setup as follows: primary HDD =- two partitions - windows and linux 7.10
secondary HDD called 'media' with all my shares
samba.conf is still there
ok, well it sounded like you discovered a second ubuntu partition or something...cus samba and fstab don't just suddenly lose their config files...
check /etc/fstab
once you make sure it's all sorted, just sudo mount -a and then i think just restart samba...
there is no /fstab
you have no idea how bad it woulda been to nto have an /etc/fstab :X
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/46993
i forget how samba handles shares...i don't remember you mount them, or you just restart the samba client...
brb
